channel.title: Window on the world
channel.description:
A series of short talks by well-known British personalities on the subjects usually associated with them.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Sir Robert Scott
item.description: Sir Robert Scott, United Kingdrom Commissioner General for Southeast Asia, on "Southeast Asia Today"
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Ailsa Garland
item.description: British journalist Ailsa Garland presents a talk titled "Women's Page," where she describes life for women in Great Britain.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: Women journalists

item.title: Sir Hugh Gaitskell
item.description: Sir Hugh Gaitskell, a British Labour politician, talks about the party system in Great Britain.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Flora Armitage
item.description: Flora Armitage, a biographer of T.E. Lawrence, gives a talk on Lawrence's life.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: Novels

item.title: Sir Alvary Gascoigne
item.description: This program features a talk by the British diplomat Sir Alvery Gascoigne. Gascoigne offers a British perspective on Soviet communism.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Kenneth Bird
item.description: Kenneth Bird, former editor-in-chief of "Punch" magazine, whose cartoons under the pen name "Fougasse" have achieved international fame. Bird gives a talk on humor.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: Wit and humor

item.title: Patrick Reid
item.description: Patrick Reid, author of "Story of Colditz" and "Men of Colditz" talks about the prisoners of Colditz.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Dame Ninette deValois
item.description: Dame Ninette deValois gives a talk about ballet.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Robin Flynn
item.description: This program presents a talk from Robin Flynn, a British newspaper correspondent, broadcaster, and author. Flynn's talk is titled "Scotland Yard: Dial 999."
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: Sociology

item.title: Rear Admiral A.D. Nicholl
item.description: Rear Adm. A.D. Nicholl gives a talk on the defense strategies employed by the West.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Joyce Cary
item.description: British novelist Joyce Cary discusses the political novel.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Earl of Listowel
item.description: The Earl of Listowel talks about the British commonwealth.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Sir Norman Angell
item.description: Sir Norman Angell, Nobel Prize winner for his book "The Great Illusion," on 'Progress and Peace: Britain and America in Changing World'
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Marshall scholarships
item.description: This program discusses how American students can apply for Marshall scholarships to study at any university in the United Kingdom.
item.dc:creator: National Association of Educational Broadcasters
item.dc:subject: Universities and colleges

item.title: Dr. Roger Manvell
item.description: Dr. Roger Manvell, director of the British Film Academy, talks about the future of film.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: NAEB Region I: The Northeast

item.title: Sir Reader Bullard
item.description: This program features a talk by British diplomat and author Sir Reader Bullard.
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Sir John Slessor
item.description: Sir John Slessor, the British Marshal of the Royal Air Force gives a talk titled "Power and Peace."
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: War & Civil Defense

item.title: Frederic Lloyd
item.description: Frederic Lloyd, general manager of the D'Oyly-Carte Opera Company, on "Gilbert and Sullivan and D'Oyly-Carte"
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: Theater & Drama

item.title: Lady Margaret D'Arcy
item.description: Margaret D'Arcy, British novelist and lecturer, gives a talk titled "Poetry for all Moods"
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: Poetry

item.title: Denis Brogan
item.description: Professor Denis Brogan, author, lecturer, educator on "How Should We Educate?"
item.dc:creator: British Information Services
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century
